awd_titl_txt: Rotational Magnetic Processes in Type-II Superconductors
awd_abstract_narration: Rotational magnetization-vector experiments will be conducted with              yttrium-barium-copper-oxide and other type-II superconductors of                current interest.  These measurements allow the total vector                    magnetization of a sample exposed to a field to be uniquely                     decomposed into a diamagnetic (shielding) component and a                       penetrating (vortex) flux component. The latter component in high-              temperature superconductors has extraordinary rotational properties             that reflect and characterize the strength distribution of the                  vortex pinning forces which, in turn, control the critical current.             The technique will sample the anisotropous of the pinning forces as             well their energy distribution.  The research will employ,                      polycrystalline, grain-oriented and single-crystal materials.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
